benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid POST payload handling (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04) – creates custom fields with various header scenarios.
Header validation and authorization (TC02, TC07, TC12) – required header presence and authentication.
Error handling for invalid input (TC06, TC08, TC09) – invalid ID format, malformed body, missing body.
Not found / non-existent invoice item (TC05, TC22, TC23) – 404 scenarios with missing invoice item.
Edge cases and input validation (TC11, TC19, TC20, TC21) – extra fields, length limits, special characters, injection attempts.
System and reliability scenarios (TC13, TC16, TC24, TC25) – service unavailable, concurrency, degraded performance, network interruption recovery.
Integration / persistence (TC18) – verify persistence via GET retrieval after POST.
Boundary cases (TC10) – empty array results in 201 with empty response.
Regression scenario (TC17) – duplicate field names behavior.
Max payload and performance basics (TC14, TC15) – large payload handling and response time baseline.
gaps: Pagination testing for GET under large datasets is not covered (no explicit tests for paginated GET results).
Caching behavior and related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) are not tested.
Explicit rate limiting/throttling tests are not present (multiple rapid POSTs not exercised).
Specialized 413 handling clarified in TC14 is optional (201 or 413) but no deterministic test asserting 413 is provided.
Explicit 400 vs 201 decision points for TC11 could be tightened with a concrete expected outcome.
recommendations: Add a dedicated GET pagination scenario to validate paging behavior for large result sets (when retrieving custom fields).
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on POST responses and/or GET after POST.
Introduce rate limiting/throttling tests (e.g., multiple concurrent requests in short time) and verify proper handling (429 or related).
Clarify and add deterministic expectations for TC11 when extra fields are present (explicitly define whether they are ignored or cause an error).
Add a deterministic 413 scenario for overly large payloads to verify proper error handling and messaging.
